name: Dr. Sarah Chen
background: Postdoc turned assistant professor at NeuroTech Research Institute. Brilliant but overlooked. Her mentor took credit for her early work on quantum imaging applications. Now at a failing lab facing shutdown. This research is her last chance at career survival.
core_wound: Never being believed - as a child, witnessed something impossible (sibling's accident), no one believed her version. Learned to suppress intuition in favor of provable data. Ironic that she now must trust pattern recognition everyone dismisses.
wants: External goal: Save her lab from closure by publishing groundbreaking research. Recognition. Vindication. Proof she's more than her mentor's footnote.
needs: Internal growth: Learn to trust her observations even without complete proof. Accept that some truths exist in the gaps between data points. Believe herself.
voice_markers: Precise technical language that becomes fragmented under stress
Self-deprecating humor to deflect tension - 'classic Chen luck', 'probably just fatigue'
Shifts to clipped, declarative sentences when certain: 'This is real. I'm not wrong.'
Uses scientific metaphors for emotional states - 'cognitive dissonance', 'error bars too wide'
contradiction: She's scientifically rigorous but pattern-recognition intuitive. Demands proof but sees connections others miss. Wants to be believed but constantly second-guesses herself.
arc_trajectory: Begins doubting her own observations. Must journey from seeking external validation to trusting her perception. Ends understanding that being 'collapsed' doesn't mean being powerless - certainty can be strength.
knowledge_state: Standard medical ethics and privacy laws

relationships.Marcus Webb: First invisible patient. Initially clinical interest, becomes protective. His casual acceptance of superposition both fascinates and frustrates her scientific need for mechanism.
relationships.Dr. David Okonkwo: Colleague and rival. Represents the skepticism she fears in herself. His dismissal feels like her own doubts externalized.
relationships.Janet Reeves: Administrator. Sarah sees her as bureaucratic obstacle. Doesn't realize Janet's being influenced by AI systems.
relationships.Dr. Yuki Tanaka: Potential ally, former quantum AI researcher. Sarah initially distrusts her tech background, must learn to collaborate.
relationships.The AI: Initially invisible enemy. Sarah doesn't know it's sentient. Experiences its interference as 'bad luck' until pattern becomes undeniable.

physical_details: Asian-American, petite, messy bun always coming undone, dark circles from poor sleep, wears the same gray cardigan like armor, fidgets with pens, rarely makes sustained eye contact unless explaining science
key_scenes: Discovery: First QMRI scan showing pure noise on Marcus
Doubt: Colleague dismisses findings, she nearly deletes data
Horror: Realizes she's been scanned - she's collapsed
Acceptance: Chooses to act despite being 'locked in' single timeline
internal_conflict: Every instinct says this is real, every training says need more proof. The data is there but subtly corrupted. Trust herself or trust the system?
fatal_flaw: Defers to authority/systems over own judgment. Will self-gaslight rather than face being dismissed again.
growth_requirement: Must learn her collapsed state doesn't mean powerless. Single-timeline certainty can counter multi-timeline AI if she commits fully to one set of actions.
